courseDetails.longDescription:

MTF is present in 215 countries and has been chosen by more than 660 000 students.


Course Author:

Dr. Alex Amoroso is a seasoned professional with a rich background in academia and industry, specializing in research methodologies, strategy formulation, and product development. With a Doctorate Degree from the School of Social Sciences and Politics in Lisbon, Portugal, where she was awarded distinction and honour for her exemplary research, Alex Amoroso brings a wealth of knowledge and expertise to the table.

In addition to her doctoral studies, Ms. Amoroso has served as an invited teacher, delivering courses on to wide range of students from undergraduate level to business students of professional and executives courses. Currently, at EIMT in Zurich, Switzerland, she lectures for doctoral students, offering advanced instruction in research design and methodologies, and in MTF Institute Ms. Amoroso is leading Product Development academical domain.

In synergy between academical and business experience, Ms. Amoroso achieved high results in business career, leading R&D activities, product development, strategic development, market analysis activities in wide range of companies. She implemented the best market practices in industries from Banking and Finance, to PropTech, Consulting and Research, and Innovative Startups.

Alex Amoroso's extensive scientific production includes numerous published articles in reputable journals, as well as oral presentations and posters at international conferences. Her research findings have been presented at esteemed institutions such as the School of Political and Social Sciences and the Stressed Out Conference at UCL, among others.

With a passion for interdisciplinary collaboration and a commitment to driving positive change, Alex Amoroso is dedicated to empowering learners and professionals for usage of cutting edge methodologies for achieving of excellence in global business world.


Course overview

● Introduction to SQL and SQLite

● Basic SQL Commands – The Foundation

● Retrieving and Manipulating Data

● Advanced Queries and Data Aggregation

● Working with Joins

● Subqueries and Nested Queries

● Modifying Data in SQL

● Optimizing and Indexing Your Queries

● Advanced SQL Features


What is SQL

● SQL stands for Structured Query Language

● It’s a domain-specific language for managing relational databases

● SQL is used to:

○ Create and modify databases

○ Query data

○ Insert, update, and delete records

● Examples of databases: MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, SQLite

● SQL is universal across relational database systems


Why SQL is Important for Business

● Marketing: SQL helps analyse customer behaviours and optimise campaigns.

● Finance: SQL is essential for tracking financial transactions and generating reports.

● Data Analytics: Extracts valuable business insights from large datasets.

● Operations: SQL can help streamline and automate workflows.

● Data-driven Decision Making: Businesses can make more informed decisions by analysing their data with SQL.


What is SQLite

● SQLite is a self-contained, serverless SQL database engine

● Open-source and free to use

● Designed for embedded database applications

● Easy to install and use

● Ideal for development, testing, and small-scale applications

● SQLite works on multiple platforms: Windows, Mac, Linux, and mobile devices
targetAudiences: No special requirements. A course for anyone who wants to build career in business and Data Analysis

courseDetails.title: Die Bandscheibe verstehen - Werde dein Bandscheibencoach

Rückenschmerzen gehören zu den häufigsten Beschwerden weltweit – und die Ursachen sind oft komplex: Bandscheibenprobleme, Dysfunktionen des Iliosakralgelenks (ISG) oder ein Beckenschiefstand können Schmerzen, Einschränkungen und chronische Beschwerden verursachen. In diesem komplett strukturierten Onlinekurs lernst du wissenschaftlich fundiertes Wissen, praxisnahe Tipps und Alltagsstrategien, die deine Wirbelsäule nachhaltig stärken.


Was du lernen wirst


  • Anatomie & Funktion: Verstehe, wie Bandscheiben, ISG und Becken aufgebaut sind und wie sie zusammenarbeiten, um Stabilität und Beweglichkeit zu gewährleisten.

  • Pathologien erkennen: Lerne die typischen Symptome von Bandscheibenvorfällen, ISG-Blockaden oder Beckenschiefständen zu identifizieren und richtig einzuordnen.

  • Diagnostik & Selbsttests: Nutze einfache klinische Tests, funktionelle Analysen und Bildgebung, um mögliche Ursachen von Rückenschmerzen zu erkennen.

  • Prävention & Therapie: Setze effektive Übungen, Core-Training, Mobilisation und Dehnung ein, um Schmerzen zu reduzieren, Dysbalancen auszugleichen und Rückfällen vorzubeugen.


Warum dieser Kurs?


  • Für jeden geeignet: Ob Einsteiger oder Sportler, ob Büroarbeiter oder aktiver Mensch – der Kurs ist klar strukturiert und progressiv aufgebaut.

  • Praxisnah & sofort umsetzbar: Du erhältst Schritt-für-Schritt-Anleitungen, Tipps für zu Hause und den Alltag sowie praktisches Wissen zur Integration in deinen Tagesablauf.

  • Wissenschaftlich fundiert: Alle Inhalte basieren auf aktuellen Studien und evidenzbasierten Erkenntnissen aus Physiotherapie, Orthopädie und Sportwissenschaft.

  • Langfristige Ergebnisse: Lerne nicht nur, Schmerzen zu lindern, sondern auch, deine Wirbelsäule, ISG und Becken dauerhaft zu stabilisieren und zu stärken.


Wer profitiert am meisten


  • Menschen mit chronischen oder wiederkehrenden Rückenschmerzen

  • Sportler und aktive Menschen, die Dysbalancen vermeiden möchten

  • Büroangestellte, die viel sitzen und Rückenschmerzen vorbeugen wollen

  • Therapeuten, Trainer oder Gesundheitsinteressierte, die ihr Wissen vertiefen möchten


Kurs-Highlights


  • 8 Module mit über 40 Lektionen

  • Ausführliche Schritt-für-Schritt-Fallbeispiele

  • Selbsttests und Diagnosetools für zu Hause

  • Praktische Alltagsintegration und Ergonomie-Tipps

courseDetails.title: Conducting Post Mortems for Business
courseDetails.shortDescription: Building Learning Organizations: Empower Teams Through Reflection, Root Cause Insight & Action
courseDetails.longDescription:
This course uses elements of Artificial Intelligence

What if the key to elevating your team’s results, shaping a resilient culture, and accelerating business growth was hiding in your past projects—both the triumphs and the setbacks? Imagine being able to pinpoint what derailed your last initiative within days, transform those lessons into actionable strategies, and create an environment where innovation thrives because failures are never wasted. Welcome to the ultimate course on Business Post Mortems: your blueprint for unlocking continuous improvement and sustainable success through truly meaningful review.

Our team, seasoned in organizational development, leadership transformation, and cross-sector project management, has seen firsthand how structured post mortem reviews can turn floundering organizations into industry leaders. In today’s fast-evolving business climate—where the difference between boom and bust is often a single misstep or missed opportunity—the skills to properly analyze, learn, and adapt are non-negotiable. Companies that systematically review, reflect, and act on their experiences win not just in profits, but in reputation, adaptability, and employee satisfaction.

This course is meticulously crafted for ambitious professionals, managers, and business leaders who refuse to settle for mediocrity. Whether you run small agile teams or lead projects in global enterprises, the knowledge and tools within will guide you step by step to harness the full power of post mortem practices.

Enter the World of High-Impact Business Reviews

From your very first session, you’ll move beyond the shallow, often ineffective “lessons learned” meetings toward a dynamic framework that creates real change. You will explore the origins and evolution of business post mortems—how they left the operating room and entered boardrooms to become a critical driver of quality, accountability, and learning. You will understand not only the historic context but also how pioneering organizations leveraged structured reflection to build longstanding competitive advantages.

Unlike courses that dwell on theory, we plunge into tangible methods and applications, tracing the path from the earliest roots of post mortem thinking to current best practices. Through engaging stories, statistics, and real-world failures (some our own), we demonstrate why structured reviews are a cornerstone of sustainable business improvement in the digital age.

Turn Reflection Into Tangible Results

You’ll gain a deep appreciation for the true purpose of post mortems—not as blame sessions or bureaucratic hoops, but as essential mechanisms for discovery, creativity, and team cohesion. We guide you to link every review directly to business outcomes, tracking both the hard and soft ROI that matter to today’s organizations: improved delivery, reduced risk, higher employee morale, and greater customer satisfaction.

Through our hands-on methodology, you’ll learn to distinguish between action-oriented reviews and destructive finger-pointing. See real examples of organizations that have transformed their culture by shifting the narrative from “who failed” to “how do we grow together?” Resetting your understanding of post mortems will spark a transformation not only in your processes, but also in your leadership style and team dynamics.

Master the Art and Science of Effective Reviews

Business post mortems become exponentially more valuable when they are targeted and systematic. Our course unveils the secrets of when to launch a review (hint: it’s not just about failed projects), what criteria signal a must-review event, and how to determine the scope so your efforts are focused while still comprehensive. Using real case studies from sectors like technology and finance, you’ll walk through the process of scoping and selecting impactful reviews, avoiding common traps like over-generalization or wasted effort.

You’ll develop the ability to set clear boundaries, balance depth and breadth, and customize your approach for projects of all sizes. Learners will participate in scenario-driven exercises to hone their decision-making, culminating in a portfolio-ready case study analyzing and scoping a post mortem on a recent project.

Build Reliable, Repeatable Review Systems

Our team empowers you to move from ad hoc, inconsistent reviews to robust, standardized procedures. You’ll discover how to create actionable standard operating procedures, design repeatable meeting agendas, and leverage ready-to-use templates—all based on proven strategies from leading organizations in the digital, service, and manufacturing sectors.

The course includes interactive checklists, downloadable templates, and real business cases demonstrating structured approaches that have delivered measurable improvements. You’ll even practice building your own review workflow, which you can immediately implement to drive consistency and quality in your organization.

Engage Everyone—Break Out of Silos

No review process is effective without the right people at the table. We dig deep into stakeholder engagement strategies, shining a light on how to attract cross-functional participation and build legitimacy for post mortem initiatives. Learn from dramatic stories—like a major product launch brought back from the brink—where stakeholder involvement made the difference between failure and renaissance.

You’ll build skills in stakeholder mapping, communication, and buy-in techniques, with dedicated modules focused on overcoming resistance, dispelling myths, and embedding post mortem value into your organizational DNA.

Make Data Work for You—Not Against You

Strong post mortems are data-driven: qualitative insights blended with quantitative rigor. We reveal best practices for data collection, avoiding bias, and analyzing both successes and failures down to their roots. Using real examples (from financial operations to creative marketing campaigns), you’ll learn how to evaluate data for telling patterns, anomalies, and hidden drivers of performance.

We equip you to harness data analytics tools, set effective KPIs, and ensure your reviews are always grounded in fact, not opinion. Sample assignments include building a data collection plan and critiquing anonymized data sets—skills immediately transferable to your own projects.

Build Psychological Safety & Master Facilitation

Without a climate of honesty and psychological safety, even the best-intentioned reviews can falter. We coach you on world-class facilitation skills, teaching you to diffuse tension, invite candid communication, and turn even skeptics into champions of the process. Drawing on leading research and practical techniques, you’ll be equipped to foster trust, handle defensiveness, and transform “failure conversations” into engines of mutual growth.

A transformational case study reveals the anatomy of a team turnaround—so you see first-hand how sensitive facilitation can unlock powerful change in even the most skeptical groups.

Uncover True Root Causes, Not Surface Excuses

If you ever felt post mortems devolve into superficial checklists, this course will show you how to dive deeper. Our expert techniques—root cause analysis, the 5 Whys, fishbone diagrams, and more—guide you to identify core issues and persistent, often hidden, patterns. By mastering these analytical approaches, you’ll move beyond symptoms to resolve problems at their source.

Assignments include conducting a root cause analysis on a supplied case, which you’ll document in your professional portfolio.

Drive Change with Actionable Improvement Plans

Learning is only valuable when it leads to change. We guide you in turning review findings into clear, prioritized action plans—assigning ownership, establishing accountability, and ensuring your recommendations become reality. Follow outlined methods for monitoring progress and driving effective follow-through long after the “lessons learned” session ends.

In a step-by-step project, you will transform a set of post mortem findings into an improvement plan suitable for presentation to leadership teams—a standout addition to your professional toolkit.

Multiply Impact with Organization-Wide Knowledge Sharing

We’ll show you how to move lessons beyond the immediate team—creating living knowledge bases, integrating insights into onboarding and training, and establishing effective channels for sharing stories and improvements. Watch as a continuous improvement culture emerges, fueled by robust lesson logs and dynamic communication.

Lead the Way Toward a Learning-Oriented Culture

The most successful organizations treat mistakes as opportunities. Our course spotlights the role of visionary leadership in making post mortems core elements of culture, not afterthoughts. You’ll learn strategies for destigmatizing failure, celebrating constructive risk-taking, and creating a truly adaptive organization.

Through interviews and stories from industry-leading businesses, we highlight how leaders harness post mortems to weave trust, respect, and innovation into their teams at every level.

Foster Real Collaboration and Inclusion

Unlock the full value of diverse thinking in reviews, as we guide you to design inclusive sessions featuring perspectives from every layer of a project. Learn how to break down silos, avoid exclusionary practices, and bring out the best in multicultural or distributed teams. Interactive activities ensure you’re ready to facilitate collaborative, high-energy reviews that drive lasting buy-in.

Measure, Adapt, and Prove Your Progress

You’ll learn how to define and track success metrics for post mortems—tying improvements to business outcomes that matter. From feedback loops to analytics dashboards, we provide tools and case studies from retail, tech, and service sectors to help you continually refine your approach.

Adapt to Any Industry—and Stay Ahead of the Curve

courseDetails.title: Building Employee Wellness Programs
courseDetails.shortDescription: Learn to create data-driven, holistic wellness strategies that boost productivity, engagement, and culture
courseDetails.longDescription:
This course uses elements of Artificial Intelligence

Did you know organizations with leading-edge employee wellness programs report up to 21% higher productivity and 41% lower absenteeism? In today’s fast-changing workplace, investing in holistic employee wellness is no longer a perk—it’s a strategic necessity. But how do you create a comprehensive, sustainable wellness strategy that actually moves the needle? That’s where our expert-developed course steps in: to give you the practical skills, research-backed frameworks, and ready-to-apply tools needed to become a champion of employee well-being in any organization.

Our team of workplace wellness professionals, industry consultants, and academic thought leaders have meticulously designed this course to serve both beginners and seasoned HR practitioners looking to elevate their impact. In a world where employee health, resilience, and engagement directly drive organizational success, your expertise in workplace wellness will not only boost business outcomes but also transform lives. Whether you aim to make a difference as an HR manager, organizational leader, or workplace wellness coordinator, you’ll find this course to be your ultimate guide for fostering happier, healthier, and more productive teams.

Begin your journey by uncovering the evolving concept of employee wellness—how it’s shifted from simple gym discounts to multidimensional strategies that nurture physical, mental, emotional, and even financial health. Here, we start with the “why”: exploring the latest research on the tangible and intangible benefits of employee wellness, from reduced healthcare costs and turnover to increased employee engagement and employer brand value. Through real-world stories and industry statistics, we highlight the historical evolution of wellness programs and expose the pitfalls organizations face in rolling them out. You’ll learn to recognize common obstacles—like lack of leadership buy-in, employee skepticism, or gaps in diversity—and how to turn these challenges into opportunities for culture change.

Our next phase focuses on assessing what your organization and its people truly need. We provide step-by-step guidance for evaluating organizational culture and readiness—the factors that determine whether a wellness initiative will thrive or languish. You’ll engage with practical wellness needs assessments and surveys tailored for organizations of every size, from start-ups to global enterprises. Through guided casework and templates, you’ll gather actionable employee feedback, interpret workplace health data, and align your wellness strategy with the core mission and evolving goals of your organization. By the end of this module, you’ll have not only assessment tools for your professional toolbox, but also the analytical lens to use this data to drive program relevance and impact.

An essential differentiator in this course is our deep dive into building a persuasive business case for employee wellness. Using ROI modeling, productivity metrics, engagement indices, and cost-benefit analyses, you’ll learn to craft compelling narratives that win decision-makers’ support—even when budgets are tight. Our storytelling workshops and budgeting guides equip you with the language, visuals, and data needed to overcome internal objections, answer tough questions, and secure long-term investment. You’ll develop and refine your own proposal, receiving expert feedback to ensure you walk away with a presentation-ready business case suitable for leadership teams, boards, or external partners.

You’ll move immediately into the practical realm of program design, learning how to integrate best-in-class strategies for physical health—including nutrition education, movement challenges, ergonomic upgrades, and chronic disease management approaches. We bring these lessons to life through cross-industry case studies and practical scenarios, ensuring you can adapt tactics to your unique environment. But total wellness is more than physical health, and our journey unfolds into the critical spheres of mental well-being and emotional health. Learn to recognize early warning signs of stress, burnout, and mental health struggles—then put into practice innovative, evidence-based interventions like resilience workshops, mindfulness programs, and supportive policy design.

Driven by our commitment to actionable outcomes, we offer unique tools for maximizing engagement. Discover how to create enthusiasm—not resistance—around wellness initiatives through strategic communication campaigns, creative incentives, and peer-driven participation models. You’ll analyze what actually sparks participation in organizations as diverse as multinational corporations, nonprofits, and public agencies. Our proven frameworks address and dismantle barriers to engagement, ensuring inclusivity and equity are embedded throughout your program design.

Modern workforces are beautifully complex—multi-generational, multi-cultural, remote, hybrid, and uniquely individual. That’s why we invest heavily in teaching you how to tailor wellness initiatives to meet the diverse needs of your teams. Master the nuances of program adaptation for different age groups, cultural backgrounds, genders, and accessibility requirements, using hands-on scenario planning and facilitated workshops. Our case examples spotlight how leading organizations customize wellness for remote teams, employees living with disabilities, and global offices—transforming differences into organizational strengths.

Preventive care and assessment are cornerstones of high-impact wellness programs. We walk you through implementing health screenings, risk assessments, and preventive care campaigns in a manner that prioritizes ethics and employee privacy. Learn how to partner with healthcare providers, facilitate on-site services, and use anonymous health data to drive strategic improvements—all while upholding strict confidentiality and regulatory compliance.

Nutrition, ergonomics, and the creation of healthy work environments tie wellness to daily experience. Through immersive modules, you’ll learn to design healthier break rooms, encourage hydration and balanced diets, set up ergonomic workstations, and create physical environments that subtly but powerfully encourage well-being. Benefit from walkthroughs, before-and-after workplace transformations, and environmental wellness project blueprints to apply immediately in your own context.

Burnout is one of the most urgent issues facing today’s workers and organizations alike. Explore its causes, costs, and warning signs, then shift to actionable resilience-building strategies rooted in organizational psychology and leader-driven change. You’ll learn to facilitate stress reduction, structure supportive policies, and empower supervisors to become champions of well-being rather than contributors to burnout. Our case studies showcase how organizations have turned the corner on workplace stress, dramatically improving morale, retention, and performance.

A groundbreaking aspect of our curriculum is our in-depth focus on financial wellness. Recognizing that financial stress is one of the leading detractors from employee health and productivity, we equip you to integrate financial education, counseling, and assistance into your wellness portfolio. Examine the profound impact of financial wellness initiatives through research and case studies, and develop targeted interventions to support your workforce in times of need or transition.

In an increasingly digital world, technology is a double-edged sword: it introduces new risks but also enables scalable, accessible solutions. We teach you how to harness digital platforms, mobile apps, wearables, and virtual wellness resources to enhance program reach and engagement, all while maintaining rigorous standards for data privacy and compliance. Explore comprehensive frameworks for evaluating the impact and reach of digital wellness tools, ensuring your solutions are responsive to evolving workplace trends like remote work, flexible schedules, and global teams.

Measuring impact is as important as program design. In our analytics-driven modules, you’ll learn to identify and track key performance indicators (KPIs), collect and analyze feedback, conduct benchmarking, and regularly assess wellness program outcomes. Develop robust evaluation reports, data visualizations, and communication strategies for sharing your successes with leadership and your broader organization. Our comprehensive guides and assessment rubrics will leave you ready to demonstrate value and drive continuous improvement.

Communication is the engine of sustainable wellness. Our modules on wellness communications strategy empower you to craft powerful messages for different audiences, leverage multiple channels (from digital newsletters and all-hands meetings to peer-led workshops and social platforms), and celebrate individual and collective successes in a way that sustains momentum year-round. Real-world communications case studies highlight cultures of wellness that thrive on connection, trust, and inspiration.

Leadership’s role is examined in depth, with actionable modules on cultivating wellness champions, training supervisors, and modeling healthy behaviors at all levels. We explore how leadership buy-in transforms organization-wide outcomes and inspire you with data-driven stories of leadership-led wellness turnarounds. Our project-based assignments will challenge you to create your own leadership development plans for wellness.

As you progress, you’ll develop vital partnerships—learning how to identify, evaluate, and collaborate with vendors, healthcare providers, community organizations, and local resources to expand your impact without overextending internal resources. Joint wellness events and innovative community collaborations offer expanded possibilities for engagement and benefit design.

Change is the only constant, and our course concludes by preparing you to become an agile wellness architect—anticipating and responding to external crises, public health trends, and evolving workforce preferences. You’ll use cutting-edge change management tactics to ensure your wellness programs remain fresh, effective, and aligned with best practices for the future. Through reflection, adaptation, and continuous improvement, you’ll create all-weather wellness strategies ready for whatever tomorrow brings.

Finally, we help you weave well-being into the fabric of your organizational culture by establishing rituals, rewards, and systems that sustain healthy habits and foster belonging. Learn to build trust, ensure psychological safety, and recognize wellness achievements at all levels. Real-world case studies from high-performing organizations will inspire you to lead culture change in your own workplace.

Throughout your journey, you’ll build a comprehensive portfolio—customizing assessments, business cases, communications strategies, engagement plans, and evaluation reports all ready to be showcased to current or prospective employers. Our expert feedback, robust templates, and peer discussions support you step by step, ensuring your learning is never theoretical but directly transferable to real workplace challenges.

This course isn’t just about knowledge—it’s about transformation: for yourself, your organization, and the people you serve. With up-to-date insights into employee wellness trends, future-focused leadership strategies, and a practical roadmap for continuous development, you’ll graduate as a certified workplace wellness leader—prepared to make a tangible difference wherever your career takes you.

Enroll now and join a community of forward-thinking professionals building stronger, healthier workplaces for today and tomorrow. Equip yourself with SEO-driven, actionable expertise in employee wellness, organizational well-being, workplace health strategy, engagement, digital wellness, resilience, and beyond. Your roadmap to leading workplace wellness transformation starts here.

courseDetails.title: Windbg - A complete guide for Advanced Windows Debugging
courseDetails.shortDescription: This course has everything you need to master Windbg as well as, debugging and reverse engineering Windows OS using it.
courseDetails.longDescription:
Have you ever felt your windows operating system is hung or becoming slow or having a BSOD? Or an application crash or application hang or slow on windows? Windbg is the single most powerful, debugging and reverse engineering tool in windows platform. Windbg is like an x-ray plus mri plus ct scan for programs running on windows operating system, including the operating system itself. It helps us to root cause complicated problems like we discussed in windows ( OS ) and programs running inside the operating system.

Just like the name implies this training has all the details which you need to master windbg. I have spent all my efforts to make sure this is the best and most complete windbg training available right now and I will keep adding topics to make sure that the statement is true in the future as well.


Targeted audience

Due to any reason, if you are trying to use or learn windbg, you already know what you're doing and there is no better place than this course. If you have been following my youtube series, this course is a complete super set of it. Being said that following are some of the categories of students to whom, I strongly recommend this course.

Support engineers

If you are a support engineer or Escalation Engineer who is supporting any product on windows, or Windows itself, I definitely recommend this course.

Malware analyst and cyber security professionals.

If you are into core cyber security especially on windows platform this tool should be definitely in your arsenal. When it comes to reverse engineering, I myself don't prefer to compare ida pro or any other similar tool with windbg but I always found windbg is one of the most, if not THE most powerful and productive tool when it comes to reverse engineering along with debugging.

Windows SysAdmins

Another main targeted set of audience is Windows administrators who always can take leverage from tools like this and know more about the product they are working with and troubleshoot problems they face at a totally different level.

C and C++ Programmers

Last and not least may be the most important category of students - advanced C and C ++ programmers which includes, driver developers, testers, software maintenance engineers and so on. Are you wondering why your application is crashing, hanging, slow or taking too much resources? That too happens once in a blue moon in production and you have no way to reproduce the issue in your dev environment. Are you asked to debug a problem in a code base you have no clue about? Or you just want to see exactly what that latest feature of cpp 20 is doing behind the scenes? This training is for you.


To summarise, this course is for anyone who wants to study windows internals and advanced production debugging on windows. Post this training you don't have to read every single windows internals and debugging books out there but you will debug whatever you want to know whatever you want to know, rather than reading some abstract result from some books.

Post this training you will not have to read and learn OS internals from any books but you will debug and understand it as and when you need it.


Course Structure

This course has 3 chapters

In Chapter 1 we discuss the necessary concepts to get us started and mostly focus on the commands of the debugger.

In Chapter 2 we apply what we have learned in Chapter 1 to different debugging scenarios, like crashes, hangs, slowness, leaks and more. We will be using test applications for this chapter and we will have source code of these test applications. First we will discuss User mode issues and then we will go into Kernel mode.

In chapter 3 we will use the knowledge gained in Chapter 1 and 2 to troubleshoot real production like or production issues. In this chapter we will discuss analysis of memory dumps which we don't have source code or any idea about. We will start with issues from sysinternals notmyfault and slowly get into true production debugging scenarios. I will keep adding lessons to this chapter if there is enough interest from students on this course. Students also can submit dumps to this chapter and they can get the dumps analyzed for free of cost and share the experience with others.

courseDetails.title: Excel Data Mastery: Formulas, Functions, Charts, and Graphs
courseDetails.shortDescription: Master Excel's data analysis and visualization tools: formulas, functions, charts, and graphs.
courseDetails.longDescription:
Master Excel from the Ground Up – Formulas, Functions, Visualizations & More!


This course is designed for anyone who wants to go beyond basic spreadsheet operations and truly harness Excel's capabilities. Whether you're a beginner looking for a solid foundation, an intermediate user aiming to level up your skills, or a professional seeking to enhance your data driven decision-making, you'll find immense value in our practical, hands-on approach.


We'll start with the fundamentals of powerful formulas and functions, moving into advanced data manipulation techniques, and culminating in the creation of impactful charts and graphs that tell compelling stories with your data. Through clear explanations, real world examples, and guided exercises, you'll build the confidence to tackle any data challenge.


What you'll learn:


  • Excel Formula Fundamentals & Best Practices: Master the basics of constructing effective formulas, understanding cell references (relative, absolute, mixed), and writing efficient calculations.

  • Essential Excel Functions for Data Manipulation: Dive deep into powerful functions like SUM, AVERAGE, COUNT, MAX, MIN, and advanced logical functions such as IF, AND, OR, NOT.

  • Lookup and Reference Mastery: Conquer data retrieval with VLOOKUP, HLOOKUP, INDEX, MATCH, and the highly sought-after XLOOKUP (for newer Excel versions) to efficiently combine and extract data.

  • Text and Date Functions for Data Cleaning: Learn to clean and transform data using functions like LEFT, RIGHT, MID, LEN, FIND, SEARCH, CONCATENATE (CONCAT), TEXTJOIN, TRIM, CLEAN, DATE, YEAR, MONTH, DAY, TODAY, NOW, and DATEDIF.

  • Conditional Aggregation with SUMIFS, COUNTIFS, AVERAGEIFS: Perform sophisticated data summaries based on multiple criteria, allowing for dynamic reporting and analysis.

  • Introduction to Dynamic Array Functions (for Excel 365/2021 users): Get a head start with modern functions like SORT, SORTBY, UNIQUE, FILTER, SEQUENCE, and RANDARRAY to streamline complex tasks.

  • Crafting Professional Charts & Graphs: Understand the principles of effective data visualization and learn to create a wide array of charts including Column, Bar, Line, Pie, Scatter, Area, and Combination Charts.

  • Advanced Chart Customization and Formatting: Discover how to tailor your charts with titles, labels, legends, axes formatting, data series customization, trendlines, and more to enhance clarity and impact.

  • Using Sparklines and Conditional Formatting: Add mini-charts directly in cells and apply rules to highlight data trends and anomalies visually.

  • Organizing and Summarizing Data with Tables & PivotTables (Introduction): Get an overview of how Excel Tables enhance data management and a sneak peek into the power of PivotTables for advanced summarization.

  • Tips and Tricks for Efficiency: Boost your productivity with keyboard shortcuts, data validation, and other time-saving techniques.


By the end of this course, you will be able to:


  • Write complex and efficient Excel formulas and functions with confidence.

  • Clean, prepare, and manipulate raw data for analysis.

  • Generate meaningful insights from large datasets.

  • Create a wide variety of professional and impactful charts and graphs.

  • Communicate your data stories effectively through stunning visualizations.

  • Work more efficiently and confidently with Excel, saving time and increasing accuracy.


Enroll now and become an Excel Data Master – turning numbers into narratives and insights into action!

Individuals preparing for roles that require strong Excel proficiency in data analysis and reporting.
Students, professionals, and anyone who needs to analyze data and present findings clearly.
Who want to learn Excel from the ground up, focusing on practical data skills.

Operations management (OM) is the administration of business practices to create the highest level of efficiency possible within an organization. It is concerned with converting materials and labor into goods and services as efficiently as possible to maximize the profit of an organization. OM covers all aspects of a business, from the design and management of products, services, and processes, to the management of supply chains and logistics.


Importance of Operations Management Skills for Career and Business:

Developing skills in operations management can significantly benefit your career and entrepreneurial endeavors in the following ways:

Career:

  • Enhanced Employability: Operations management skills are highly sought after in various industries, including manufacturing, healthcare, technology, retail, and service sectors. Expertise in OM can open up a wide range of career opportunities, such as operations manager, supply chain analyst, production planner, quality manager, project manager, and more.

  • Increased Earning Potential: Professionals with strong operations management skills often command higher salaries due to their ability to optimize processes, reduce costs, improve efficiency, and drive overall business success.

  • Problem-Solving and Decision-Making Abilities: Operations management equips you with the skills to analyze complex problems, identify bottlenecks, and make data-driven decisions that lead to improved operational performance. These skills are valuable assets for any career path.


Business management is the process of planning, organizing, directing, and controlling the resources (financial, human, and material) within an organization to achieve its goals and objectives effectively and efficiently. It encompasses a wide range of activities, from setting strategic direction and making operational decisions to managing resources and leading people.


Importance of Learning Linked Topics:

  • Business Models and Value Propositions: Understanding how businesses create, deliver, and capture value is crucial for identifying opportunities, developing new products or services, and ensuring long-term sustainability.

  • Strategic Management and Planning: This involves setting long-term goals, analyzing the competitive environment, and developing strategies to achieve success. Strong strategic thinking is essential for making informed decisions and guiding the organization towards its vision.

  • Organizational Behavior and Leadership: Effective leaders understand how to motivate and inspire teams, manage conflict, and create a positive work environment. Knowledge of organizational behavior is key to building high-performing teams and fostering a culture of innovation.

  • Risk Management and Business Continuity Planning: Businesses face a variety of risks, from financial and operational disruptions to natural disasters. Risk management involves identifying potential threats, assessing their impact, and implementing strategies to mitigate or avoid them. Business continuity planning ensures that critical operations can continue in the event of a disruption.

  • Change Management and Organizational Development: Organizations must continuously adapt to remain competitive. Change management skills are essential for leading and managing change initiatives effectively, while organizational development focuses on improving the overall performance and effectiveness of the organization.

  • Corporate Governance and Compliance: This involves ensuring that the organization operates ethically, transparently, and in accordance with relevant laws and regulations. Strong corporate governance practices build trust with stakeholders and protect the organization's reputation.


By developing a comprehensive understanding of business management and related topics, you'll gain the knowledge and skills necessary to build a successful career, make a positive impact, and contribute to the growth and development of your organization.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. A course for anyone who wants to build career in business

Customer experience (CX) is the overall impression customers have of your brand throughout their interactions with your business. It encompasses everything from the initial marketing message to the post-purchase support they receive. Think of it as the customer journey, and CX is all the touchpoints along the way that shape their perception.


Key Areas of CX

  • Customer touchpoints: Every interaction a customer has with your brand, like websites, social media, advertising, in-store experience, and customer service.

  • Customer journey: Mapping out the steps a customer takes to interact with your brand, from awareness to purchase and beyond.

  • Customer satisfaction: How happy customers are with your product or service.

  • Customer loyalty: How likely customers are to return and recommend your brand to others.


CX Frameworks

Frameworks provide a structured approach to improving CX. Here are two common ones:

  • Customer Experience Journey Map: A visual representation of the customer journey, identifying touchpoints and opportunities for improvement.

  • Five Service Dimensions: A framework that focuses on five key aspects of service quality: reliability, responsiveness, assurance, empathy, and tangibles.


Why Learning CXM is Important for Companies:

  1. Improved Customer Satisfaction and Loyalty: CXM focuses on understanding and meeting customer needs, leading to increased satisfaction and a higher likelihood of repeat business.

  2. Enhanced Brand Reputation: Positive customer experiences contribute to a strong brand reputation, attracting new customers and retaining existing ones.

  3. Increased Revenue and Profitability: Satisfied customers are more likely to spend more, refer others, and remain loyal, all of which contribute to revenue growth.

  4. Competitive Advantage: In today's crowded marketplace, exceptional customer experience can be a key differentiator, setting a company apart from its competitors.

  5. Reduced Costs: Resolving customer issues proactively and efficiently can reduce the cost of customer service and support.


Why Learning CXM is Important for Building a Career as a Manager:

  1. In-demand Skill: CXM is a highly sought-after skill in today's business world, as companies increasingly recognize its importance.

  2. Career Advancement: Expertise in CXM can open doors to various managerial roles, such as Customer Experience Manager, Customer Success Manager, or Marketing Manager.

  3. Problem-solving Skills: CXM involves identifying and addressing customer pain points, which enhances problem-solving and analytical skills.

  4. Leadership Development: Managing customer experience initiatives requires strong leadership, communication, and collaboration skills.

  5. Cross-functional Collaboration: CXM often involves working with multiple departments, providing managers with exposure to different areas of the business.


Overall, learning CXM is crucial for companies looking to thrive in the modern business landscape. It's also a valuable investment for managers aiming to build a successful career in various industries.


What is Marketing?

  • Definition: Marketing is the process of identifying customer needs, creating products or services that fulfill those needs, and communicating the value of those offerings to potential customers.

  • Focus: Marketing focuses on getting the right message to the right audience, ultimately driving interest and sales.

  • Key Activities:

    • Market research

    • Product development

    • Brand building

    • Advertising and promotions

    • Content creation

    • Customer relationship management


What is Marketing Management?

  • Definition: Marketing management is the strategic and operational process of planning, organizing, implementing, and controlling an organization's marketing resources and activities.

  • Focus: Marketing management aims to create a cohesive marketing plan, optimize resource allocation, and measure the effectiveness of marketing initiatives.

  • Key Activities:

    • Developing marketing strategies and plans

    • Setting marketing budgets

    • Managing marketing teams

    • Overseeing marketing campaigns

    • Analyzing marketing performance (tracking metrics and ROI)

    • Making adjustments to strategies as needed


The Relationship Between Marketing and Marketing Management

Think of marketing as the actions you take to promote your business, and marketing management as the overarching system to plan, execute, and refine those actions strategically.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. A course for anyone who wants to build career in marketing and business

courseDetails.longDescription:
Welcome to course: Product Marketing: Advanced Go-to-Market (GTM) Strategy by MTF Institute


Are you ready to stop just participating in product launches and start leading them? In crowded market, a great product isn't enough. A strategic, data-driven, and masterfully executed Go-to-Market (GTM) strategy is what separates market leaders from forgotten failures. This course is your complete blueprint for building and executing that strategy.


Master the Entire Go-to-Market Lifecycle from Strategy to Global Execution.


Whether you're an aspiring Product Marketer or a seasoned professional looking to master the latest frameworks, this comprehensive program will give you the tools, confidence, and in-depth knowledge to drive impactful product launches and accelerate business growth.

  • Master Modern GTM Motions like Product-Led Growth (PLG) to build products that sell themselves.

  • Define and Dominate Your Market by learning the advanced art of Strategic Messaging and Category Design.

  • Price Your Products with Confidence by moving beyond simple models to advanced, value-based pricing and packaging strategies.

  • Launch with Precision using a professional Tiered Launch Framework for everything from a quiet update to a blockbuster release.

  • Build a Revenue Machine by creating a high-impact Sales Enablement program and a powerful partner ecosystem.



Go-to-Market Strategy is the single most critical function for driving product success. It’s the strategic bridge between building a great product and creating a thriving business. A great GTM plan aligns your entire company—from product and marketing to sales and support—on a single mission: to effectively deliver your product's value to the ideal customer. This course demystifies that process, providing you with a step-by-step guide to navigating every stage with the expertise of a seasoned leader.


What makes this course unique? It’s a complete masterclass, structured in three powerful parts:

  1. The Foundation (Video Lessons): We begin with engaging video lessons covering the fundamentals of Product Management and Development. You'll get a solid grounding in the entire product lifecycle, from idea generation and agile development to product metrics.


  2. The Core GTM Playbook (Textual Lessons): Next, you'll dive into a comprehensive textual module covering the 10 foundational pillars of Go-to-Market Strategy. This section ensures you have a rock-solid understanding of market analysis, value proposition, pricing, launch planning, and more.


  3. The Advanced Masterclass (NEW Expert Textual Modules): This is where this course truly stands apart. We go far beyond the basics with 10 brand new, expert-level modules on advanced GTM strategy. This is an MBA-level deep dive into the modern frameworks that are defining the future of marketing:

    • Advanced Market Intelligence & ICP Definition

    • Strategic Messaging, Positioning & Category Design

    • Advanced Pricing & Packaging Strategies

    • Mastering Product-Led Growth (PLG)

    • Building a High-Impact Sales Enablement Program

    • GTM Channel Strategy: Building a Partner Ecosystem

    • The Tiered Launch: From MVP to Blockbuster

    • Post-Launch Optimization & Customer Marketing

    • GTM Analytics: Measuring What Matters

    • Global GTM: International Expansion & Localization


This course is brought to you by the MTF Institute, an official partner of IBM, Intel, and Microsoft, and led by Dr. Alex Amoroso, a seasoned professional and academic with deep expertise in strategy, product development, and research methodologies. You will learn proven frameworks grounded in both academic rigor and real-world business success across a wide range of industries.

By the end of this course, you will not just understand Go-to-Market strategy; you will have a complete, actionable playbook to plan, execute, and measure winning product launches throughout your career.


Ready to become a GTM expert? Enroll today and start building winning go-to-market strategies!

Customer experience (CX) is the overall impression customers have of your brand throughout their interactions with your business. It encompasses everything from the initial marketing message to the post-purchase support they receive. Think of it as the customer journey, and CX is all the touchpoints along the way that shape their perception.


Key Areas of CX

  • Customer touchpoints: Every interaction a customer has with your brand, like websites, social media, advertising, in-store experience, and customer service.

  • Customer journey: Mapping out the steps a customer takes to interact with your brand, from awareness to purchase and beyond.

  • Customer satisfaction: How happy customers are with your product or service.

  • Customer loyalty: How likely customers are to return and recommend your brand to others.


CX Frameworks

Frameworks provide a structured approach to improving CX. Here are two common ones:

  • Customer Experience Journey Map: A visual representation of the customer journey, identifying touchpoints and opportunities for improvement.

  • Five Service Dimensions: A framework that focuses on five key aspects of service quality: reliability, responsiveness, assurance, empathy, and tangibles.


Why Learning CXM is Important for Companies:

  1. Improved Customer Satisfaction and Loyalty: CXM focuses on understanding and meeting customer needs, leading to increased satisfaction and a higher likelihood of repeat business.

  2. Enhanced Brand Reputation: Positive customer experiences contribute to a strong brand reputation, attracting new customers and retaining existing ones.

  3. Increased Revenue and Profitability: Satisfied customers are more likely to spend more, refer others, and remain loyal, all of which contribute to revenue growth.

  4. Competitive Advantage: In today's crowded marketplace, exceptional customer experience can be a key differentiator, setting a company apart from its competitors.

  5. Reduced Costs: Resolving customer issues proactively and efficiently can reduce the cost of customer service and support.


Why Learning CXM is Important for Building a Career as a Manager:

  1. In-demand Skill: CXM is a highly sought-after skill in today's business world, as companies increasingly recognize its importance.

  2. Career Advancement: Expertise in CXM can open doors to various managerial roles, such as Customer Experience Manager, Customer Success Manager, or Marketing Manager.

  3. Problem-solving Skills: CXM involves identifying and addressing customer pain points, which enhances problem-solving and analytical skills.

  4. Leadership Development: Managing customer experience initiatives requires strong leadership, communication, and collaboration skills.

  5. Cross-functional Collaboration: CXM often involves working with multiple departments, providing managers with exposure to different areas of the business.


Overall, learning CXM is crucial for companies looking to thrive in the modern business landscape. It's also a valuable investment for managers aiming to build a successful career in various industries.


Importance of Education in Digital Transformation for Companies and Managers:

In the  business environment, digital transformation has emerged as a key driver of competitive advantage and long-term success. Embracing digital technologies is no longer an option but a necessity for companies to remain relevant and thrive. However, implementing digital transformation initiatives requires more than just adopting new tools; it demands a comprehensive understanding of digital trends, customer behavior, data analytics, and organizational change management. This education helps companies and managers:


Strategic Adaptation: Digital transformation education empowers organizations to align their strategies with the opportunities and challenges presented by the digital age. It helps leaders identify potential areas for disruption and develop agile responses to stay ahead of the competition.


Enhanced Customer Experience: Understanding digital transformation enables businesses to design and deliver exceptional customer experiences, which are crucial for customer retention and loyalty in today's customer-centric market.


Data-Driven Decision Making: The course equips managers with skills in data analysis and interpretation, enabling them to make data-driven decisions that lead to improved business outcomes.


Innovation and Creativity: Participants will learn about emerging technologies and innovation processes, fostering a culture of creativity within their organizations and driving continuous improvement.


Organizational Resilience: With digital transformation education, managers can build resilient organizations capable of adapting to disruptions and thriving in times of uncertainty.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. A course for anyone who wants to build career in business

courseDetails.title: Cours complet : Microservices Spring Boot – Projet réel
courseDetails.shortDescription: Apprenez à Créer et Appliquer des Microservices avec Spring Boot : Du Développement à l'Intégration dans un Projet Réel
courseDetails.longDescription:
Maîtrisez les microservices avec Spring Boot grâce à un cours complet et orienté entreprise.

Bienvenue dans "Cours complet : Microservices Spring Boot – Projet réel", une formation complète conçue pour approfondir vos compétences en développement et vous accompagner dans la résolution de défis concrets grâce aux microservices et à Spring Boot.

À qui s'adresse ce cours ?

Ce cours s’adresse aux développeurs souhaitant maîtriser la conception et l’implémentation de microservices avec Spring Boot. Que vous soyez débutant ou expérimenté, vous y trouverez des concepts essentiels et avancés pour exceller dans le développement logiciel moderne.

Comment ce cours va-t-il vous aider ?

  1. Développement de Compétences Techniques
    Ce cours va au-delà des bases de la programmation. Il vous guide dans la conception de systèmes modulaires, évolutifs et performants, même si vous débutez avec Spring Boot.

  2. Approche Pratique Basée sur des Cas Réels
    Vous travaillerez sur des problématiques courantes rencontrées en entreprise et apprendrez à les résoudre efficacement avec les microservices.

  3. Application des Meilleures Pratiques
    Vous découvrirez les principes essentiels pour garantir la robustesse, la sécurité et la maintenabilité de vos applications microservices.

  4. Maîtrise Approfondie de Spring Boot
    Une exploration détaillée des concepts fondamentaux et avancés de Spring Boot vous permettra d’optimiser l’utilisation de ce puissant framework.

  5. Approche Agile et Déploiement Rapide
    L’agilité est essentielle dans le développement moderne. Vous apprendrez à mettre en place des méthodes de travail efficaces pour accélérer le cycle de développement et de déploiement.

Contenu du cours

  1. Développement de microservices avec Spring Boot
    Apprenez à concevoir des services autonomes et optimisés en exploitant les fonctionnalités avancées de Spring Boot.

  2. Stratégies de Déploiement Agile
    Découvrez les meilleures pratiques pour assurer un déploiement fluide, de la phase de développement jusqu’à la mise en production.

  3. Gestion des Données en Architecture Microservices
    Maîtrisez les techniques pour assurer la cohérence des données et minimiser les conflits dans des environnements distribués.

  4. Sécurisation des Microservices
    Apprenez à protéger vos services grâce à des mécanismes avancés d’authentification et d’autorisation.

Pourquoi choisir ce cours ?

Contrairement aux formations classiques, ce programme est spécifiquement axé sur la résolution de problématiques réelles. Vous serez immergé dans des projets pratiques où chaque module vous apportera des compétences applicables immédiatement. De plus, le contenu est régulièrement mis à jour pour refléter les meilleures pratiques et les évolutions technologiques du domaine.

Prérequis

  • Avoir des bases en Java.

  • Une première expérience avec Spring est un plus, mais pas indispensable.

Certification et Validation des Acquis

À l’issue de la formation, vous recevrez un certificat attestant de vos compétences en microservices avec Spring Boot. Une preuve concrète de votre maîtrise des concepts enseignés, valorisable dans votre parcours professionnel.

Commencez dès maintenant !

Inscrivez-vous dès aujourd’hui et commencez votre apprentissage. Développez des compétences qui vous démarqueront dans le monde du développement logiciel moderne. Nous sommes impatients de vous accompagner dans ce parcours passionnant !
targetAudiences: Si vous êtes un développeur Java en quête de compétences avancées pour la création d'applications hautement évolutives, ce cours vous offre une ressource inestimable.

Les architectes logiciels y trouveront également une opportunité de comprendre en profondeur la conception de systèmes évolutifs, les meilleures pratiques de développement, et les avantages de l'architecture de microservices.

Cependant, cette formation n'est pas uniquement destinée aux professionnels de l'informatique. Les étudiants en informatique en quête de compétences pratiques pour leur future carrière y trouveront également de la valeur, tout comme les entrepreneurs désireux d'acquérir des connaissances essentielles pour la création de systèmes logiciels flexibles et performants.

Risk management is the process of identifying, assessing, and controlling potential threats to an organization. These threats, or risks, could stem from a wide variety of sources.


Here are the main focuses of risk management:

  • Identification: Finding potential risks that could affect your organization or project. This involves brainstorming, looking at past issues, and considering what might happen in the future.

  • Assessment: Determining the likelihood of those risks happening and how severe the impact would be if they did. This helps prioritize which risks need the most attention.

  • Control: Taking steps to reduce the likelihood of the risks happening or to minimize their impact if they do. This might involve things like putting safety procedures in place, buying insurance, or having backup plans.


Why is it important?

  • Minimizes losses: By identifying and managing risks, companies can reduce financial losses, protect their reputation, and avoid legal issues.

  • Improves decision-making: Risk management provides a framework for making informed decisions, considering potential downsides and opportunities.

  • Enhances resilience: It helps companies to be prepared for unexpected events and to bounce back quickly from setbacks.

  • Increases the likelihood of success: By addressing potential problems proactively, companies can increase their chances of achieving their goals.


For managers specifically:

  • Protects their team: Managers are responsible for the safety and well-being of their team. Risk management helps them create a safe work environment and minimize potential harm.

  • Builds trust: Employees trust managers who are prepared and take steps to protect them from risks.

  • Improves performance: When risks are managed effectively, employees can focus on their work without worrying about potential problems.


In uncertain world, risk management is more critical than ever. It's an essential skill for companies and managers who want to thrive in the face of challenges.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. A course for anyone who wants to build career in business and risks

From Zero to Building Real JavaScript Apps — Step by Step


Tired of JavaScript tutorials that throw you into React on lesson 2 or drown you in theory?

This course is your clear, fast, and brutally practical path into real programming — no fluff, no overwhelming frameworks, just pure, modern JavaScript that works in both browser and server.

No prior experience needed.

Just curiosity, a computer, and the urge to build something that actually does something.

You’ll code from minute one. You’ll build real projects like:

  • a password strength checker with live feedback

  • a simple contact list manager

  • interactive buttons that actually respond

  • a fully functional todo app with add/delete/mark as done

By the end you’ll be dangerous — able to automate tasks, build interactive websites, manipulate the DOM like a pro, fetch data from APIs, or confidently continue into React, Node.js backends, or full-stack development.

What You’ll Actually Learn (and Use Immediately)

  • Write and run JavaScript in browser AND Node.js from day 1

  • Master modern syntax: let/const, arrow functions, template literals

  • Control flow: if/else, switch, loops, break/continue

  • Data structures: Arrays & Objects — real-world usage with push, map, filter, etc.

  • Functions: declarations, parameters, return values, arrow functions

  • DOM manipulation & events — make web pages actually respond

  • Query elements, change content/style, handle click/input events

  • Async basics: setTimeout/setInterval, Promises, async/await

  • Debug like a pro (browser console, Node.js, error handling)

  • Hands-on exercises, practice tasks and quizzes in every section

Who This Course Is Perfect For

  • Complete beginners who tried freeCodeCamp or YouTube and got lost

  • Python/Ruby devs wanting to add JavaScript to their toolbox

  • Designers who want to go beyond HTML/CSS

  • Career changers aiming for junior front-end or full-stack roles

  • Anyone who wants to build real shit instead of just watching tutorials

Requirements

  • A computer (Windows, Mac, or Linux)

  • Internet (to install Node.js and VS Code)

  • Zero prior coding knowledge — seriously

Ready to finally understand JavaScript instead of just copying Stack Overflow?

Click "Enroll Now" and write your first line of real, working JavaScript — today.

Your future as a confident developer doesn’t start with another 10-hour “theory” video.

It starts with one line of code that does exactly what you want.

Let’s write it together.

courseDetails.title: Security Optimizer: Protege tu Sitio Web en WordPress 2025
courseDetails.shortDescription: Aprende a cómo proteger tu sitio web en WordPress de ataques y vulnerabilidades con el plugin Security Optimizer.
courseDetails.longDescription:
Security Optimizer es un plugin gratuito de WordPress desarrollado por SiteGround para proteger un sitio web de WordPress y prevenir una serie de amenazas como ataques de fuerza bruta, inicios de sesión comprometidos, fugas de datos y más.


¿CUÁLES SON LAS CARACTERÍSTICAS Y BENEFICIOS DE SECURITY OPTIMIZER?

El plugin ofrece características como:

  • Evitar el malware común.

  • Defenderte contra los ataques de fuerza bruta.

  • Añadir protección XSS avanzada para proteger carpetas críticas y que no se inyecten archivos maliciosos.

  • Ocultar tu versión de WordPress.

  • Eliminar el archivo readme.txt predeterminado.

  • Proteger el inicio de sesión.

  • Habilitar verificación en dos pasos (con Google Authenticator).

  • Cambiar la URL de inicio de sesión.

  • Impedir usar «admin» como nombre de usuario.

  • Las actividades quedan registradas en el Activity log y además facilita funciones para reaccionar ante posibles ataques desde la sección «Acciones después de un hackeo» para:

    • Cerrar sesión automáticamente a todos los usuarios.

    • Obligar a cambiar las contraseñas.

    • Reinstalar todos tus plugins.


Nuestro curso es 100% práctico, lo guiaremos a través de diversos pasos y juntos mejoraremos la seguridad de su sitio web en WordPress con el plugin Security Optimizer, de modo que al finalizar nuestro curso, tendrá su sitio web protegido de ataques y vulnerabilidades.

courseDetails.title: Data Analyst: Professional Certificate in Data Analysis
courseDetails.shortDescription: Data Based Decision Making, Data Analysis. Data Collection, Cleaning, Statistical Analysis, Visualisation, Privacy.
courseDetails.longDescription:
Welcome to Program: Data Analyst: Professional Certificate in Data Analysis by MTF Institute


Course provided by MTF Institute of Management, Technology and Finance

MTF is the global educational and research institute with HQ at Lisbon, Portugal, focused on business & professional hybrid (on-campus and online) education at areas: Business & Administration, Science & Technology, Banking & Finance.

MTF R&D center focused on research activities at areas: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, Big Data, WEB3, Blockchain, Cryptocurrency & Digital Assets, Metaverses, Digital Transformation, Fintech, Electronic Commerce, Internet of Things.

MTF is the official partner of: IBM, Intel, Microsoft, member of the Portuguese Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

MTF is present in 216 countries and has been chosen by more than 712 000 students.


Course Authors:

Dr. Alex Amoroso is a seasoned professional with a rich background in academia and industry, specializing in research methodologies, strategy formulation, and product development. With a Doctorate Degree from the School of Social Sciences and Politics in Lisbon, Portugal, where she was awarded distinction and honour for her exemplary research, Alex Amoroso brings a wealth of knowledge and expertise to the table.

In addition to her doctoral studies, Ms. Amoroso has served as an invited teacher, delivering courses on to wide range of students from undergraduate level to business students of professional and executives courses. Currently, at EIMT in Zurich, Switzerland, she lectures for doctoral students, offering advanced instruction in research design and methodologies, and in MTF Institute Ms. Amoroso is leading Product Development academical domain.

In synergy between academical and business experience, Ms. Amoroso achieved high results in business career, leading R&D activities, product development, strategic development, market analysis activities in wide range of companies. She implemented the best market practices in industries from Banking and Finance, to PropTech, Consulting and Research, and Innovative Startups.

Alex Amoroso's extensive scientific production includes numerous published articles in reputable journals, as well as oral presentations and posters at international conferences. Her research findings have been presented at esteemed institutions such as the School of Political and Social Sciences and the Stressed Out Conference at UCL, among others.

With a passion for interdisciplinary collaboration and a commitment to driving positive change, Alex Amoroso is dedicated to empowering learners and professionals for usage of cutting edge methodologies for achieving of excellence in global business world.


Dr. Pedro Nunes has built a multifaceted career combining academia and practical business expertise. His educational journey culminated with a Doctorate in Economic Analysis and Business Strategy with a cum laude mention from the University of Santiago de Compostela. Professionally, he has navigated through various sectors, including technology, international commerce, and consultancy, with roles ranging from business analyst to director. Currently, Pedro serves as a Professor in several DBA programs, applying his extensive industry experience and academic insights to educate the next generation of professionals.


"Data Analyst: Professional Certificate in Data Analysis" course is structured to provide a comprehensive learning experience, starting with foundational data analysis skills and progressing to specialized applications and advanced techniques. Here's a breakdown of the key sections:


Section: Data Analysis (Core Foundational Skills)

  • This section lays the groundwork for data analysis, covering essential concepts like data collection, cleaning, preparation, and exploratory data analysis (EDA).

  • It delves into statistical analysis, data visualization, and predictive analytics.

  • Crucially, it addresses data interpretation, reporting, privacy, and ethics, ensuring a well-rounded understanding.

  • You'll also gain insights into the tools and software used in data analysis, portfolio building, and career development.


Section: Introduction to Business and Data Analysis (Supplementary Module)

  • This module bridges the gap between data analysis and business application.

  • It focuses on understanding business needs, defining problems, and applying data analysis techniques to solve business challenges.

  • You'll explore data types and sources, business data analysis techniques, and data visualization for business insights.

  • Case studies and discussions on the role of technology in business and data analysis are included.


Section: Hands-on Experience (Practical Application)

  • This section emphasizes practical skills development through hands-on exercises using industry-standard tools.

  • You'll gain experience with Excel, SQL, Python, R, and Tableau.

  • Exercises focus on tasks like retrieving and analyzing data, handling missing data, conducting statistical analysis, and creating data visualizations.


Section: Data-Based Decision Making (Strategic Application)

  • This section focuses on using data to inform decision-making processes.

  • It covers various types of analytics (descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive) and how they contribute to data-driven decision-making.

  • You'll learn about data-driven culture, tools and technologies, and real-world case studies.


Section: Advanced Microsoft Excel Usage (Specialized Skill)

  • This module dives deep into advanced Excel functionalities, including advanced formulas, data analysis, visualization, data management, and automation with macros and VBA.

  • The module also talks about AI powered excel with Gemini and Copilot.

  • It includes numerous practical exercises to reinforce learning.


Section : SQL and SQL for Data Analysis (Database Skills)

  • This section provides a comprehensive understanding of SQL, covering basic commands, data retrieval and manipulation, advanced queries, joins, subqueries, and data modification.

  • It also covers query optimization, indexing, and advanced SQL features.

  • The module concludes with a final project and assessment preparation.


Section: Specialization: Data Analysis in Marketing (Supplementary Module)

  • This module is focused on the application of data analysis within a marketing context.

  • It covers marketing data types, sources, key metrics, analytical models, segmentation, predictive analytics, A/B testing, campaign analysis, ethical considerations, and building a data-driven marketing culture.


Section: Specialization: Sales & Service Data Analysis & Analytics (Supplementary Module)

  • This module is focused on the analysis of data within sales and service enviroments.

  • It covers topics such as sales trends, pipeline analysis, conversion rate optimization, customer churn prediction, and using data to improve customer support efficiency.

  • It also covers data sources, quality, and cleaning.


Section: Specialization: Data Quality, Management & Governance (Supplementary Module)

  • This module focuses on the principles and practices of data governance and management.

  • It covers data governance frameworks, roles, responsibilities, data quality management, and the use of data governance tools and technology.


Section: Data Based Decision Making and Cost-Benefit Analysis (Supplementary Module)

  • This module combines data-based decision-making with cost-benefit analysis.

  • It covers how to gather, analyze, and interpret data for decision-making, and how to conduct cost-benefit analyses to evaluate potential initiatives.

  • It also covers the tools and technologies used for data-based decision-making.


Data analysis is the process of collecting, cleaning, and organizing data to uncover patterns, insights, and trends that can help individuals and organizations make informed decisions. It involves examining raw data to find answers to specific questions, identify potential problems, or discover opportunities for improvement.  


Data analysts transform raw data into actionable insights to help organisations improve operations, strategies, and customer experiences. Core skills include statistical analysis, critical thinking, data visualisation, and proficiency in tools like Excel, SQL, Python, and Tableau.


Learning data analysis skills is crucial for career building in today's data-driven world, both for professional positions and managers of all levels. Here's why:  


For Professionals:

Increased Employability: Data analysis skills are in high demand across various industries. Professionals with these skills are more likely to secure well-paying jobs and advance in their careers.  

Improved Decision-Making: Data analysis enables professionals to make informed decisions based on evidence and insights rather than relying on intuition or guesswork.  

Enhanced Problem-Solving: Data analysis helps professionals identify the root causes of problems, develop effective solutions, and track the effectiveness of interventions.  

Increased Efficiency and Productivity: By automating tasks and identifying areas for improvement, data analysis can help professionals work more efficiently and increase their productivity.  


For Managers:

Strategic Planning: Data analysis provides managers with the insights needed to develop effective strategies, set realistic goals, and track progress towards objectives.  

Performance Management: Managers can use data to monitor team performance, identify areas for improvement, and provide targeted feedback to employees.  

Risk Management: Data analysis can help managers identify potential risks, assess their impact, and develop mitigation strategies.  

Innovation and Growth: By analyzing data on customer behavior, market trends, and competitor activities, managers can identify opportunities for innovation and growth.  


Learning data analysis skills is essential for professionals and managers of all levels who want to succeed in today's data-driven world. These skills can help individuals make better decisions, solve problems more effectively, and contribute to the success of their organizations.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. A course for anyone who wants to build career in business and Data Analysis
